thread.title: Taxi erupts in ball of flames parked in Brisbane street, gas leak suspected - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
thread.title_full: Taxi erupts in ball of flames parked in Brisbane street, gas leak suspected - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)

title: Taxi erupts in ball of flames parked in Brisbane street, gas leak suspected - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
text:
Taxi erupts in ball of flames parked in Brisbane street, gas leak suspected Posted February 25, 2017 16:23:39 Map: Taringa 4068 
Police believe a severed gas line started a fire that has gutted a maxi taxi in Brisbane's inner west. 
The taxi, which was empty and parked in a suburban street in Taringa, exploded in a ball of flames. 
The blaze was so intense it spread to a second car parked near the taxi. 
Taxi driver Jaggi Suman said he was in his apartment when someone knocked on the door to tell him his cab was on fire. 
"[It was] really huge â€” it just happened in just seconds, it didn't take even minutes, it was just burnt out really badly," he said. 
"It was just parked there mate, nobody knows what happened, it was just a mystery." 
Neighbour Sarah Barron said she heard a loud bang and headed onto the street, where she captured the blaze on camera. 
"It was quite scary," she said. 
"We just saw a large ball of smoke and some large explosions and came out and saw that a taxi was on fire. 
"It would have been above the power lines and it would have been lasting for 15 minutes."
